messages.subject: Re: Wrong Sori and "sai hai"
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Max, Saiha/Saijin- Retempered sword. Sorinaoshi- Blade curvature adjustment. Dave ... of ... is sai- ... not ... always
messages.messageBody:
Hi Max,

Saiha/Saijin- Retempered sword.

Sorinaoshi- Blade curvature adjustment.

Dave

messages.subject: Wrong Sori and "sai hai"
messages.msgSnippet: Hello to every one, I write you because I wish to know which is the name in japanese of the wrong sori I do not mean uchi-sori (I mean when the sori is
messages.messageBody:
Hello to every one,
I write you because I wish to know which is the name in japanese of
the "wrong sori" I do not mean uchi-sori (I mean when the sori is
corrected by hammer after yakiire), some one say me the name is "sai-
hai".
Can any one tell me if that is correct?
Thank you in advance,
Máximo
PS. I made a waki.
http://www.maximom.com.ar/index_archivos/wakicable1.htm those are not
good pics, but my question is: Mune-machi and ha-machi should always
be in the same line?.
